input.description:
adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter to use to handle the request.
Default value: AmazonS3ActorAdapter

wsdl location [Optional]
The target WSDL URL for Amazon S3. The value of this parameter overrides the WSDL URL value provided in adapter configuration. A sample WSDL URL is - http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/AmazonS3.wsdl

endpoint address [Optional]
The WebService endpoint to use for performing operations on Amazon S3 buckets across different regions. Respective values for different regions are as below:
* https://s3.amazonaws.com/soap — Endpoint located in the US Standard Region * https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/soap — Endpoint located in the US-West (Northern California) Region * https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/soap ---Endpoint located in the EU (Ireland) Region * https://s3-ap-southeast-1.amazonaws.com/soap ---Endpoint located in the Asia Pacific (Singapore) Region * https://s3-ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/soap ---Endpoint located in the Asia Pacific (Tokyo) Region

aws access key id [Optional]
The WebService access key is used to for identifying yourself as the sender of the request for the Amazon S3 operations. This key is provided by Amazon at the time of registration on Amazon S3 account.
Sample access key is is as follows: 1D9FVRAYCP1VJEXAMPLE=

secret access key [Optional]
Each aws access key id has a secret key associated with it. Secret key is secret and should be known only by you and AWS. This is used only to calculate signatures to include in requests sent to AWS.

items The items XML used to perform "List Bucket" operation.
Value takes the form:
<items> <item> <parameters> <bucket></bucket> <!--Optional:--> <prefix></prefix> <!--Optional:--> <delimiter></delimiter> <!--Optional:--> <max-keys></max-keys> <!--Optional:--> <marker></marker> </parameters> </item> </items>
For description of each parameter tag, please refer corresponding Adapter Actions process.

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
The List Bucket Contents operation returns information about some of the items in the bucket.
For example, to list up to 1000 keys in the "quotes" bucket that have the prefix "notes." <ListBucket xmlns="http://doc.s3.amazonaws.com/2006-03-01"> <Bucket>quotes</Bucket> <Prefix>notes/</Prefix> <Delimiter>/</Delimiter> <MaxKeys>1000</MaxKeys> <AWSAccessKeyId>1D9FVRAYCP1VJEXAMPLE=</AWSAccessKeyId> <Timestamp>2006-03-01T12:00:00.183Z</Timestamp> <Signature>Iuyz3d3P0aTou39dzbqaEXAMPLE=</Signature> </ListBucket>
